description: On March 27, 2020, it was announced that the dissemination of false information regarding coronavirus provides for criminal liability within the framework of the law in Kyrgyzstan. Distributors of fake messages related to the situation around the coronavirus in Kyrgyzstan have been detained, the press service of the State Committee for National Security said. On March 26, employees of the department detained a 56-year-old resident of Batken region, who disseminated false information about the situation with COVID-19 in the region. The second detainee, a 36-year-old resident of the At-Bashi district of the Naryn region, claimed that at the sanitary post in the village of Kochkor of the district of the same name, police officers did not check documents and demanded 200 soms for travel. "Preventive conversations were held with these persons, they repented of their deeds and asked forgiveness from the people. At present, measures are being taken to give a legal assessment of their actions," the State Committee for National Security said in a statement. Note that the department, together with law enforcement agencies, continue to work to identify individuals who spread rumors and fake information. Such cases bear criminal liability.

description: On 27 May 2020, The Ministry of Health urged Kyrgyzstanis not to self-medicate for COVID. (Kyrgyzstan) The deputy head of the department said that severe cases of treatment and cases of death of patients with coronavirus were analyzed. Deputy Minister of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic Nurbolot Usenbayev called on citizens not to self-medicate from coronavirus infection. "During the analysis, it turned out that people practiced self-medication, including doctors. This is unacceptable, given the insidiousness of the virus. You cannot self-medicate, take low-quality medications, tinctures and follow unproven recommendations. We have said before that even with the flu, self-medication can lead to complications, "Usenbaev said. He urged everyone to seek medical help at the first symptoms of COVID-19.

description: On 5 June 2020, the Ministry of Education and Science of the Kyrgyz Republic announced to not send children to kindergarten without urgent need. The ministry explained that new methods of teaching have been developed; next week, training will be held for teachers in preschool institutions. The Ministry of Education and Science urges parents not to send their children to kindergarten unnecessarily. This was announced at a meeting of the Republican Headquarters to Combat Coronavirus. Prior to that, it was announced that kindergartens will open on June 5. However, the day before, the mayor's office said that before accepting children, all kindergarten workers must undergo a coronavirus test. According to Deputy Minister of Education and Science Nadira Dzhusupbekova, an appropriate algorithm of actions has been developed, sanitary and epidemiological requirements have been approved, and a new method has been developed taking into account the observance of the rules of distancing. "We recommend that parents send their children to kindergarten only when urgently needed. If there are relatives who can look after the child, it would be more correct to leave him with them for safety reasons," she said.

description: Starting at Jan 10, 2020, at border points with China, Kyrgyzstan tightened medical control so as not to miss a new type of pneumonia. Abdykadyr Zhoroev, head of the epidemiological department of the Department of Disease Prevention and State Sanitary and Epidemiological Surveillance of the Ministry of Health, said that they receive information from the Chinese side through the World Health Organization. According to him, control has been strengthened at the checkpoints on the border with China: Torugart and Irkeshtam, as well as at the Manas airport, as flights from Urumqi arrive daily. In particular, Kyrgyz doctors use thermal imagers. "If there are first signs, including fever, that is, an increase in temperature, then thermal imagers will" catch "them. If a patient is identified, he will be isolated and treated in medical institutions. To date, no such patients have been identified," Zhoroev said. He noted that not only citizens of Kyrgyzstan, but also of China are checked at sanitary control points. That is, even if the patient is able to cross the border when contacting doctors with primary signs (fever and shortness of breath), the latter will immediately inform the Ministry of Health about him. Moreover, it does not matter whether patients will apply to private or state clinics, doctors are obliged to warn the department.

description: Starting on Jan 26th, 2020, the government of Kyrgyzstan has strengthened security measures at airports, at the borders; it is planned to create checkpoints on the border with Kazakhstan. Thermal imagers have been installed at all border checkpoints of Kyrgyzstan, as well as at the airports of Bishkek and Osh, to check those entering for the presence of coronavirus, the government press service said. Specialists of the sanitary and quarantine point (SQP) check with thermal imagers all persons arriving in Kyrgyzstan from China and third countries. 11 sanitary and quarantine points operate around the clock. They are installed on the borders with China, Tajikistan, and Uzbekistan. Now the issue of creating sanitary and quarantine points on the internal borders of the EAEU (Kyrgyzstan - Kazakhstan) is being resolved since with the entry into the EAEU such points were disbanded. Starting next week, temporary sanitary and quarantine posts will start working at the Akzhol, Dunlarov Bridge, Aktilek, and Chaldovar checkpoints. Round-the-clock control over flights from other countries is organized. Doctors carry out thermometry at the exit from the aircraft. Four portable thermal imagers are operational, the isolator is prepared.

description: Starting on April 6, 2020, potential coronavirus-infected Bishkek residents will be able to identify by phone. (Kyrgyzstan) Now Bishkek residents can get prompt medical advice on self-diagnosis by calling the hotline of the Ministry of Health 118. Physicians will collect an epidemiological history directly by phone, find out the details of the caller's well-being and fill out a questionnaire developed by specialists. The mayor's office asks residents to call if they: arrived from other countries within the last 30 days; visited epidemically disadvantaged regions of the country; have had close contact with an infected COVID-19; were at observation points or in-home quarantine under the supervision of doctors; have the following symptoms: fever, cough, shortness of breath. "If there is a threat of detecting an infection, mobile teams of doctors will go to the scene: a doctor, an epidemiologist and a laboratory assistant, they will do an express screening right at home. According to the results of an express test, the patient will be isolated at home until the results of the PCR analysis in a virological laboratory.Law enforcement agencies will ensure safety ". The self-test line runs from 8 am to 7 pm. A mobile application has also been developed to record the movements of citizens in quarantine with a daily questionnaire on the state of health. Every citizen in quarantine is now under SMART control.

description: On 29 June 2020, Jeenbekov signed a law on the status of health workers. (Kyrgyzstan) The law prescribes what guarantees and compensation can be received by medical workers of state institutions during emergency and emergency situations. At the same time, in certain circumstances, employees of private clinics can count on these guarantees. President Sooronbai Jeenbekov signed a document amending the Law "On the status of a medical worker", the press service of the head of the Kyrgyz Republic reports. The law was adopted by the Jogorku Kenesh on May 21, 2020. "This law was adopted in order to establish guarantees and compensations for medical workers of state and municipal health organizations, including in cases of introduction of an emergency or state of emergency," the message says. In particular, Article 11-1 appeared. It is about the fact that in an emergency or emergency, the authorized body in the field of health is obliged to: organize transport delivery of medical workers of state and municipal health organizations from their place of residence to their place of work and back; provide medical workers with the necessary personal protective equipment and proper working conditions. This article also provides for the payment of monetary compensation to health workers who are at high risk of harm to their health during the period of emergency and emergency situations. It is determined by the government, but not less than four salaries for the position held.

According to this algorithm, all citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic arriving from countries where cases of coronavirus infection have been registered will be divided into two categories. The list of countries can be changed in accordance with the development of the epidemiological situation in the world. The first category includes the following countries: China, Italy, Iran, Spain, Republic of Korea, Germany, France, USA, Switzerland, UK, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Sweden, Belgium, Denmark. This list comes into effect on March 19, 2020. Thus, Kyrgyzstanis arriving from the countries of the first category, including in transit, are subject to observation for 14 days in specially designated places. This category includes all citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic: holders of ID-cards, civil, service and diplomatic passports. The person who violated the conditions of observation is subject to prosecution in accordance with the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic. The second category includes all countries where the coronavirus has been detected. All citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic, arriving including in transit from countries of the second category, are subject to home quarantine for a period of 14 days.

description: On Mar 11 2020, due to the coronavirus in Kyrgyzstan, the period for issuing a passport will be reduced. Acceptance of documents is carried out in any territorial subdivisions of the SRS or in public service centers, regardless of the place of residence. The term for the production and issuance of general civil passports in Kyrgyzstan will be shortened for some time from 18 to 12 working days, the press service of the State Registration Service reported. The reason is the ban on crossing the border with an ID card introduced from March 1 in order to prevent the coronavirus COVID-19 in the country. "If, when issuing a passport in the usual manner, citizens received it after 18 working days, now they will be able to receive it six days earlier. No additional payment will be charged," the message says. It was noted that the State Center for Personification is now working in an enhanced mode in two shifts - night and day. The department recalls that the acceptance of documents for the registration and production of a general civil passport is carried out in any territorial subdivisions of the State Registration Service or in public service centers (PSC), regardless of the place of residence. Citizens temporarily outside the republic can apply for a passport to diplomatic institutions. For the convenience of citizens, three mini-public service centers were opened in Bishkek, which work on weekends.

description:
On 16 May 2020, Bishkek residents are not allowed into the mountains for barbecue - posts have been established. (Kyrgyzstan) People noticed that checkpoints had been set up near the village of Koy-Tash and there was a big traffic jam. Bishkek residents, who leave the city for barbecue, should turn around and go back, said the first deputy akim of the Alamudun region Emil Chakibaev. Chakibaev said that this is a filtration post, he does not know how many there are in the region, but there are three in his area: two at the arch and one in Koi-Tash. Its task is to limit the number of citizens from the quarantine zone, or, in other words, to prevent people from entering Bishkek. "Summer residents, people who have a residence permit in the upper zone, or those who travel in transit further, for example, to the Issyk-Ata region, are allowed in. But people mostly go out into the countryside to fry barbecues, with barbecues, we turn them back. The emergency mode has not been canceled. Also, a lot of people go to the kumis treatment. Many were sent back, "the deputy akim said.
He noted that these posts were established in March since the introduction of the state of emergency.

description:
Kyrgyz athletes will resume preparations for the Olympics from June 1. (Kyrgyzstan) The State Sports Agency promises to control that sanitary norms and rules are not violated at the training site. Kyrgyz national teams will begin training sessions (TCB) from June 1 in preparation for international tournaments, the press service of the State Agency for Youth Affairs, Physical Culture and Sports said. First of all, it is about the Olympic teams, which will prepare for the licensed championship participants in order to get a ticket to the Tokyo Olympics. National teams in non-Olympic and national sports will also start preparing in case of resumption of international competitions. This decision was made as part of the phased lifting of quarantine in the country and the restoration of the activities of sports facilities. 
Before the start of the TCB, members of the national teams will undergo a medical examination at a sports and rehabilitation center. At the training sites, sanitary norms and rules will be observed, hygienic and anti-epidemic measures will be taken, as well as an entry procedure with contactless control of the body temperature of athletes will be organized, the state agency noted. There is no mention of organizing tournaments yet.

description: On 22 June 2020, The National Bank transfers part of its personnel to the "remote office" - the third case of COVID has been revealed in the office. This is the third case of COVID-19 infection among the employees of the National Bank. The first case became known on May 27, the second - on June 18. At the same time, the National Bank continues to work as usual. All major business processes are running smoothly. It is reported that in order to minimize the risks of infection with COVID-19, the reception of citizens on personal matters was temporarily suspended and access to the building of the National Bank for visitors was limited.
